bug.summary: EdgeBatch.edges() call attempts tuple item assignment
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
TypeError: 'tuple' object does not support item assignment <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior: import dgl import torch g = dgl.DGLGraph() g.add_nodes(11) h = torch.rand(11, 7) g.nodes[:].data["h"] = h g.add_edges(list(range(10)), 10, {"etype": torch.ones(10)}) g.add_edges(list(range(10)), list(range(10)), {"etype": torch.zeros(10)}) qnodes = torch.tensor([10]) def edgefilter(eb: dgl.EdgeBatch): ret = (eb.edges()[1].unsqueeze(0) == qnodes.unsqueeze(1)).any(0) ret &= eb.data["etype"] == 1 return ret
g.filter_edges(edgefilter) This throws the above mentioned exception, from the call to EdgeView.edges() <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Not to throw errors. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
